rename.from: [one-var] Wrong auto-fix when the vars are exported
rename.to: [one-var] Autofixing this rule drops some exported vars

issue.title: [eslint] Adds rule `one-var` and autofixes all related errors

repository.name: wp-calypso
repository.description: The JavaScript and API powered WordPress.com

issue.body:
#### Changes proposed in this Pull Request

* Enables estline rule [`one-var`](https://eslint.org/docs/rules/one-var). It forbids patterns like:

    ```
    let var1, var2;
    ``` 
    
    and autofix them to
    ```
    let var1;
    let var2;
    ``` 

* Apply `one-var` autofix across the codebase.
* Run `prettier` in affected files.
* Manually fix https://github.com/Automattic/wp-calypso/pull/47310/files#diff-3ec97767860a9c864e12180449bc1777637d3861ece2fd2139fd12f335516c01 because it hit the bug https://github.com/eslint/eslint/issues/13834

After applying this rule it should be easier to autofix [`no-var`](https://eslint.org/docs/rules/no-var) and [`prefer-const`](https://eslint.org/docs/rules/prefer-const)


#### Testing instructions

* Ignore code style errors, there will be a ton.
* This change should be safe, nothing to test. If the test are green it means that the app can be compiled and therefore the autofix didn't include any syntax error.

body:
Hi @scinos, thanks for the bug report!

I can confirm this in [online demo](https://eslint.org/demo#eyJ0ZXh0IjoiLyplc2xpbnQgb25lLXZhcjogW1wiZXJyb3JcIiwgXCJuZXZlclwiXSovXG4vKmVzbGludC1lbnYgZXM2Ki9cblxuZXhwb3J0IGNvbnN0IGZvbz0xLCBiYXI9MjsiLCJvcHRpb25zIjp7InBhcnNlck9wdGlvbnMiOnsiZWNtYVZlcnNpb24iOjYsInNvdXJjZVR5cGUiOiJtb2R1bGUiLCJlY21hRmVhdHVyZXMiOnt9fSwicnVsZXMiOnt9LCJlbnYiOnt9fX0=), PR is welcome.

I haven't had time lately, and I don't think I will have in the near future.

All yours :)

issue.title: Fix: one-var autofixing for export (fixes #13834)
